results.title: Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Dance series”
For the dancer, time is the awareness of duration. The film moves from the traditional musical definition of time into other areas of the time sense.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and E.J. Perry

results.title: Timber town
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Oliver Howes
results.brief_description: Looks at life in a timber town located in the hardwood forest area of the southwestern coast of Western Australia. Shows Karri forests, tree felling, reforestation, controlled burning of undergrowth, timber hauling and milling. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Timber sense
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1961 film shows some of the ways in which accidents may be prevented in the timber production industry, in forests and sawmills. While working in the forest, the film shows the importance of wearing safety helmets and boots to avoid the danger of falling limbs; creating a clear getaway from felled trunks; and safely loading logs onto a timber truck. It then shows safe practices when working in sawmills, including wearing safety glasses to protect against sawdust and splinters; installing guards on circular saws; and keeping the floor clear.

Produced by the Tasmania Department of Film Production for the Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Timber fences and gates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Enables the beginner to construct fences and gates with professional results. It introduces various fencing and gate designs, advising the viewer on material and tool requirements. It suggests wood and general preparation techniques and finally advises on the construction and assembly of gates and fences.

results.title: Timber
results.brief_description: A survey of the forests from which Australia obtains timber supplies for firewood, building and other industrial purposes. Illustrates tree-felling and the various methods used to transport logs to timber-mills. Overviews the preservation of natural forests and revegetation programs.

results.title: Tim to the seashore
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions, Anthony Larsen, Sam Pillsbury and Rod Prosser
results.brief_description:
Short non-narrated film of a small boy’s meanderings and discoveries along a beach. Aims to assist in the development of communication skills.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
